result.execSummary:
The defendant ROGER P. VIGIL was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Winnebago County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Court's Office immediately. Failure to do so shall result in a Judgment being placed against the Defendant for any outstanding amount.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and fingerprints and photograph pursuant to Wis. Stats. 970.02(7).  IMMEDIATELY following court, contact (920) 236-4906 to schedule an appointment.  Arrangements to complete collection shall be made within 72 hours.  At time of appointment, Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. ROGER P. VIGIL

records.addlTxt: 9:58 AM  Prosecuting attorney David C. Rashid in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant ROGER P. VIGIL in court.  Attorney Emma K Blankschein in court for ROGER P. VIGIL. Defendant advised of and waives rights.  Enters plea freely and voluntarily and proceeds to sentencing.  Victim/Witness rights complied with.   Offer of fine and costs placed into court record.  Sentencing arguments made by parties.

Court amends bond.  24/7 Program condition lifted.  REMAINING CONDITIONS:   No violent contact with V1 and Brenda Z in Neenah PD 22-07321.    Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol consumption or possession.  Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are.

02:24 PM Defendant ROGER P. VIGIL in court with attorney Emma K Blankschein. Prosecuting Atty Amanda Folger appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: CONDITIONS:   No violent contact with V1 and Brenda Z in Neenah PD 22-07321.  Comply with the Alcohol 24/7 Program. Defendant shall contact (920)232-1919 IMMEDIATELY after their court hearing to schedule an appointment to be set up on the program.  If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  The defendant shall bring the Alcohol Monitoring Device to every hearing.  Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol consumption or possession.  Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are.

2:36 PM Defendant ROGER P. VIGIL in court with attorney Eric R Heywood.  Defendant ROGER P. VIGIL in custody.  Amanda Nash appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ROGER P. VIGIL appeared by video means with Attorney.  Given/has complaint. Advised of charges & potential penalties.  The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 2:42.
faxed to Sheriff's Office for handout to DE with their copy of the criminal complaint.
